intro: Celmisia coriacea var. stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf celmisia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
